For everyone who was forced to watch this, here's what you need to know:
1: eclipse means the obscuring of the light from one celestial body
2: In a solar eclipse, the sun gets darker, and in a lunar eclipse, the moon gets darker
3: In a solar eclipse, the moon is blocking out light from the sun and casts a shadow on the earth
4: In a lunar eclipse, the earth blocks out the light from the sun, so earths shadow is cast on the moon
5: The moon is a full moon during a lunar eclipse, and a new moon during a solar eclipse
6: We don't always see a lunar eclipse whenever there is a full moon because the moon orbits the earth at an angle, meaning that the sun can't cast a shadow on the earth onto the moon because they're not in a straight line

i noticed she in the video didn't explain the cool stuff about a lunar eclipse it's true the moon gets darker joining total lunar eclipse but joining the total phase she didn't say that moon doesn't disappear or she didn't say that some of the sunlight reaches the moon during the  total phase mainly orange or red which why the moon turns red or orange during a total lunar eclipse and depends on how clear the earths shadow is it can change to yellow or gold or blue and turquoise or a coppery brown , orange or red every eclipse is different from one to the next she also didn't explain there 4 different types of solar eclipses partial solar eclipse part of the sun is blocked by the moon. total solar eclipse the moon blocks all direct sunlight, annular eclipse is where the moon on the far side on its orbit when it passes in front of the sun completely it can't block all direct sun light cuz the moon is smaller than the sun during annular solar eclipse so the sun looks like a ring with a dark centre and hybrid solar eclipse are rare they are annular-total as the moon shadow moves across the earth some place on earth will see the annular eclipse and others on its path will see a total solar eclipse before near the end of the eclipse path it changes back to a annular and it possible it can end as a total solar eclipse as well  3 different types of lunar eclipse penumbral lunar eclipse is where the moon passes in to the faint outer shadow these eclipse are very hard to see cuz the earths penumbral shadow is so faint to see about 70% of the moon has to be in the penumbral shadow for you to notice anything happening. a partial lunar eclipse is where the moon passes partly in to earths dark umbral shadow and the full moon looks like a bite been taken out of it  and a total lunar eclipse is where moon passes completely in the earth dark umbral shadow some of the sun rays make it threw mainly orange or red sunlight which why the moon looks this colour during a  total lunar eclipse it as possible for the  moon to turn a blue and turquoise or a yellow or gold or grey or even brown or a coppery red or orange colour depending on how clear the earth dark umbral shadow is and also during total phase of a lunar eclipse or from one total lunar eclipse to the next eclipse total lunar eclipse the moons appearance changes all the time so they are always different same with solar eclipse.

The Lunar eclipse cause slightly different than 6 Solar months because The Moon is twirling around the Earth. That causes the moon to go in the shadow late. Also, the distance between the Sun and the Earth isn't constant. That also has effects on the Lunar Eclipse.
Hahahahahah solar sme lunar sem

The really amazing thing is that our planet evolved an intelligent species capable of observing eclipeses (and realizing their significance) during the short period when such eclipses can occur. A few million (or billion) years ago eclipses were probably world-wide phenomena - an eclipse blocking the light of the sun or moon planet-wide. A few million years into the future and eclipses won't occur at all. This is due to the changing distance between the Earth and the Moon. Right now, while humans occupy the planet, these three heavenly bodies are juxtaposed such that they cause what we might call a Goldilocks eclipse - not too much, not too little. Enjoy it while you can.
